crew_hellstone_scavengers_xp_condition: Acquired Hellstone or an Artefact, executed a successful scavenge operation or kept trespassers at bay.
crew_outlaw_posse_xp_condition: Execute a successful battle, robbery, thievery, murder or jailbreak
crew_bounty_hunters_xp_condition: Execute a successful bounty or treasure hunt.
crew_tribe_xp_condition: Execute a successful hunt, raid, or spiritual conquest
crew_ability_veteran_description: Choose a special ability from another crew (can be taken more than once).
crew_ability_patron_description: When you advance your Tier, it costs half the coin it normally would. Who is your patron? Why do they help you?
crew_ability_bloundhounds_description: Each PC may add +1 action rating to Command, Sling, or Hunt (up to a max rating of 3).
crew_ability_a_walking_rogues_gallery_de: When your posse has the chance to talk it out you will recognize every lawman / outlaw you see in real life or on a picture. You know if there is a bounty on their head and its value.
crew_ability_life_line_description: You bring ‘em in alive. You may choose that your target is only incapacitated instead of dead. There’s always a little bit of life left in them.
crew_ability_an_eye_for_it_description: You may read artefacts or Hellstone weapons to find out what they do and how they are dangerous. With that you always get good details.
crew_ability_really_useful_description: Sometimes friends are as good as territory. You may count up to three +3 faction statuses you hold as if they are claims.
crew_ability_lucky_fellows_description: When you roll events, roll twice and keep the one you want. When you reduce doom on the posse, take +1d.
crew_ability_heigh_ho_description: Each PC may add +1 action rating to Attune, Disable, or Prowl (up to a max rating of 3).
crew_ability_transporter_description: When you execute a Travel Plan to start your run or Hellstone Scavenge, take +1d to the engagement roll.
crew_ability_dig_dug_description: No way to rip you off. When you acquire Mining equipment or explosives, you get +1 result level to your roll.
crew_ability_leverage_description: Your posse supplies 'found stuff' for other factions. Your success is good for them. Whenever you gain rep, gain +1 rep. Which factions? Who’s angry about this arrangement? Which quality rating of which location is affected by this arrangement?
crew_ability_got_used_to_the_strange_lif: Got Used to the Strange Life
You get +1d to resistance rolls against supernatural threats including delving too deep. You get +1d to healing rolls when you have supernatural harm.
crew_ability_undue_hellish_confidence_de: No one can beat your posse as long you have Hellstone around (at least it feels this way). Once per run you may regain 1 Grit if you make a Mutation Roll.
crew_ability_deadly_serious_description: Each PC may add +1 action rating to Command, Sling, or Brawl (up to a max rating of 3).
crew_ability_blood_brothers_description: When you fight alongside your cohorts in combat, they get +1d for teamwork rolls (setup and group actions). All of your cohorts get the Thugs type for free (if they're already Thugs, add another type).
crew_ability_straightforward_description: When you execute an assault plan, take +1d to the engagement roll.
crew_ability_fiends_description: Fear is as good as respect. You may count each Rider as if it were claims.
crew_ability_forged_in_the_fire_descript: Each PC has been toughened by cruel experience. You get +1d to resistance rolls.
crew_ability_war_dogs_description: When you’re at war (-3 faction status), your posse does not suffer -1 hold and PCs still get two downtime activities, instead of just one.
crew_ability_watchers_description: Each PC may add +1 action rating to Attune, Hunt, or Survey (up to a max rating of 3).
crew_ability_into_the_burning_beyond_des: The spirits showed you the shifting paths into the Burning Beyond and back. You may attune to visit places of the Beyond if you respect the inhabitants and bring appropriate offerings. You don’t have to leave the way you came.
crew_ability_horseback_is_home_descripti: You get +1d while on horseback. You speak the language of horses. You may ask them to Gather Information with +1 effect. You lose 3 grit when your horse dies.
crew_ability_one_with_the_land_descripti: You may command the spirits of the land or ask kindly for their help or advice. You may ignore one consequence if the sprits chose to provide cover. Or you may gain +1d if they chose to help you on your path.
crew_ability_one_with_the_people_descrip: When you have a downtime in your people’s homestead, your tribe has one additional downtime action and gains +1d to Acquire Asset. Describe how this can be.
crew_ability_stalkers_of_demons_descript: You were taught to sense the weakness of demons using taboo magic. If you successful attune to a demon the GM will tell you its weakness and how it may be destroyed. On a CRIT you may learn its true name.
crew_ability_theyre_with_us_description: You carry a symbol of your people / land; describe it and the grim bounding ritual. As long as you carry it, your tribe gets +1d against Delving too Deep and +1d Resistance against creatures from the Burning Beyond or other spirits as well as against dread or despair. If you lose the symbol or it is destroyed, all get 3 level harm 'disheartened'. May only be healed by restoring the symbol somehow.
crew_upgrade_bounty_rigging: Bounty Rigging (2 free load for weapons or documents)
crew_upgrade_scavenger_rigging: Scavenger Rigging (2 free load for tools or weapons)
crew_upgrade_outlaw_rigging: Outlaw Rigging (2 free load for weapons or armor)
crew_upgrade_tribe_rigging: Tribe Rigging (2 free load for weapons or implements)
crew_hellstone_scavengers_contact_3: Grover McIntyre, a Hardware Store Owner
crew_hellstone_scavengers_contact_5: Old Man Bruford, a Gin Mill
crew_outlaw_posse_contact_5: Old Man Bruford, a Gin Mill Owner
upgrade_hidden_description: Your hideout has a secret location and is disguised to hide it from view. If your hideout is discovered, use two downtime activities and pay Coin equal to your Tier to relocate it and hide it once again.
upgrade_carriage_description: You have a carriage, two horses to pull it, and a stable. A second upgrade improves the carriage with armor and more, larger, swifter horses.
upgrade_quarters_description: Your hideout includes living quarters for the posse. Without this upgrade, each PC sleeps elsewhere, and is vulnerable when they do so.
upgrade_secure_description: Your hideout has locks, alarms, and traps to thwart intruders. A second upgrade improves the defences to include arcane measures that work against spirits and ghosts. You might roll your posse’s Tier if these measures are ever put to the test, to see how well they thwart an intruder.
upgrade_vault_description: Your hideout has a secure vault, increasing your storage capacity for Coin or Hellstone to 8. A second upgrade increases your capacity to 16. Note that for proper storage of Hellstone you have to get the “Hellstone Storage” upgrade as well. A separate part of your vault can be used as a holding cell.
upgrade_escape_tunnel_description: Your hideout has a hidden tunnel, its exit some distance away from your hideout. You may escape unseen if your hideout is under attack.
upgrade_workshop_description: Your hideout has a workshop appointed with tools for crafting, as well as a small library of books, documents, and maps. You may accomplish long-term projects with these assets without leaving your hideout.
upgrade_hellstone_storage_description: Your storage and your Vault have proper Hellstone storage facilities. This does not give you extra capacities but makes the normal storage or the usage of the Vault save.
upgrade_rail_connection_description: Your hideout is accessible via special rail track. If your hideout is also hidden this applies to your rail track as well.
playbook_the_fist_description: Like a cobra ready to strike
playbook_the_fist_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with force or physical expression.
playbook_item_fine_hand_weapon_descripti: A personal weapon of high quality. A stone or metal tomahawk, a sable, a bayonete. A BIG knife. A brass knuckle with a name.
playbook_item_fine_heavy_weapon_descript: A finely crafted two-handed melee or ranged weapon of your choice. A rifle, a bow, a sable, a greatsword, a battleaxe, a tomahawk.
playbook_item_scary_weapon_or_tool_descr: A scary-looking hand weapon or tool. This item grants increased effect when you intimidate, not increased harm in combat.
playbook_item_picture_of_a_lost_love_des: A link to the past. 'Lost' may not mean 'dead'.
playbook_item_bottle_of_whiskey_descript: A distillation to steel your nerves. Potent both in its alcohol and its ability to get someone to talk and give away a secret.
playbook_item_pack_of_bandages_descripti: Cloth strips to stop the bleeding. Maybe useful to tie hands or blindfold somebody.
playbook_the_shot_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with speed or flair.
playbook_the_shot_friend_0: Arthur Fog, a fake Native / Showman
playbook_the_shot_friend_1: Ralph 'Bad Egg' Horn, a Gun Smith
playbook_the_shot_friend_3: Black Hoof, a Native Chief / Hunter
playbook_item_fine_and_flashy_pair_of_pi: A finely crafted and decorated pair of pistols. Potent both in hurting and impressing people. Maybe useful to impress creatures that like shiny things.
playbook_item_fine_rifle_description: A finely crafted two-handed repeating rifle (Henry or Winchester for example). Maybe a customization or custom-built for a specific purpose.
playbook_item_lightning_a_fine_horse_des: A realiable ally and mean of transportation. May provide potency for quickness-, endurance- or  spectacle-related actions.
playbook_item_special_ammunition_descrip: Some bullets for a special purpose. Maybe useful against demons, ghosts, undeads or spirits. Maybe useful in the Burning Beyond. Describe what makes them special and how they look like.
playbook_item_fine_disguise_kit_descript: A theatrical make-up kit equipped with an impressive array of expert appliances to fool the eye. The fine quality of this kit may increase the effect of your deceptive actions.
playbook_item_a_message_from_an_admirer_: A text, symbol or object which states a message. Who's the admirer? What does they want? What did you promise? Is a 3rd person able to understand the message, too?
playbook_the_law_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with authority or stamina.
playbook_the_law_friend_2: Karl 'No Teeth' McCann, a cold Killer
playbook_item_fine_pair_of_pistols_descr: A matched pair of handguns, made for greater accuracy and impact. How do they stand out from the average handgun?
playbook_item_fine_shotgun_description: A finely crafted shotgun, deadly at close range, losing accuracy and impact at longer range. May hit more than one target at close range. Did you make personal modifications?
playbook_item_badge_of_authority_descrip: An easy recognizable badge of a specific authority. Which one is this? How does it look like? Is it well-used and worn or shiny new?
playbook_item_fine_documents_description: A set of documents, a mandat, an official order, a wanted poster, a warrent, a reference, a letter of recommendation.
playbook_item_manacle_and_chains_descrip: A set of heavy manacles and chain, suitable for restraining a prisoner. Multiple sets connects to form a chain-gang.
playbook_item_a_keepsake_description: An emotional / sentimental thing from the past. What is it you don't want to forget?
playbook_the_gamble_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with deception or audacity.
playbook_item_fine_extravagant_melee_wea: A finely crafted exoctic melee weapon. How did you get it? Did it came from a strange land? Is it difficult to handle?
playbook_item_fine_playing_cards_and_dic: Gambling accouterments subtly altered to favor particular outcomes. The fine quality of this kit may increase the effect of your deceptive actions when you use it.
playbook_item_badge_of_authority_descrip: An outfit that appears to be of such fine make as to pass you off as an upper class or very rich member of the community.
playbook_item_a_set_of_won_valuable_docu: A set of won valuable documents
A valuable document like a deed, a map, a certificate, an ancient book. Who do you won it from? Will they keep looking for it?
playbook_a_fine_story_description: A plausible story with sufficient details to explain something or to impress somebody. The fine quaility may increase the effect of your deceptive actions.
playbook_item_a_small_token_of_luck_desc: It did not fail you in the past and as long as you own it, better times will come again. How does it look like? How came it into your possession?
playbook_the_scout_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with tracking or stealth.
playbook_item_fine_hunting_knife_descrip: A trusted tool, equally suited for killing and hunting. The fine quality may increase the effect of your hunting or combat actions when you use it.
playbook_item_fine_rifle_or_bow_descript: A finely crafted hunting rifle or bow, deadly at long range, unwieldy in close combat. Bow is a silent hunter. Did you craft it by yourself?
playbook_item_fine_leather_clothes_descr: Animal traps of various sizes, suitable to kill smaller creatures and cripple larger ones. A snare, a bear trap. May come with camouflage or cover to avoid early spotting.
playbook_item_traps_description: Animal traps of various sizes, suitable to kill smaller creatures and cripple larger ones. A snare, a bear trap. May come with camouflage or cover to avoid early spotting.
playbook_item_fine_horse_with_saddle_des: Not only your realiable ally and mean of transportation, but also able to communicate with you up to a certain extend. May provide potency for quickness- or endurance-related actions.
playbook_item_outdoor_survival_kit_descr: A blanket, eating utentsils, preserved meat & a filled waterskin, a telescope/spy glas, firestarter, a compass, a saw, a mirror, a rope
playbook_the_outlaw_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with breaking the rules or daringness.
playbook_the_outlaw_friend_3: a Friend you still owe money
playbook_item_a_fine_pistol_description: A handgun, made for greater accuracy and impact. How do they stand out from the average handgun? Maybe it has a more threatening look?
playbook_item_fine_rifle_or_bow_descript: A shotgun, deadly at close range, losing accuracy and impact at longer range. May hit more than one target at close range. Or a Rifle deadly at long range, not so good at close quarters. How did you get it?
playbook_item_a_fine_poncho_or_sombrero_: Weather-resistent piece of clothing not only helpful in the wild but also to conceal even bulky pieces of equipment.
playbook_item_a_guitar_case_description: You may store a guitar in it or other 'equipment' hidden in plain sight.
playbook_item_a_fine_spirit_bane_descrip: Like a normal bane with potential more effect on spirits, ghosts and undeads. What do you channel your willpower through it? What is its origin?
playbook_item_a_small_piece_of_hellstone: So, why would a sane being carry that around and keep it close?
playbook_the_thunderheart_description: A Totem-fighter born from the Land
playbook_the_thunderheart_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with athletics or spiritual power.
playbook_the_thunderheart_friend_4: Hunter, a Spirit of the Land
playbook_item_fine_bow_with_arrows_descr: A finely crafted bow, deadly at long range, unwieldy in close combat. Capable of shooting arrows extremly silent. Did you craft it by yourself? Did a spirits helped you or gave it to you?
playbook_item_fine_weapon_description: A melee or throwing weapon of high quality. A stone or metal tomahawk, a captured sable. A special knife. How do it stand out from the average weapon?
playbook_item_spirit_bane_or_charm_descr: A small symbol or trinket that spirits, ghosts and maybe undead prefer to avoid or find attractive. How does it look like? What is it origin?
playbook_item_light_climbing_gear_descri: A well-crafted set of climbing gear that is less bulky and heavy than a standard set.
playbook_item_taboco_poison_medicine_des: Tabaco for its calming effect for body and mind, or a potent poision or other medicine.
playbook_item_a_totems_gift_description: A gift from a totem. How did you get it? Does it help with something? What price did/do you pay for the permission to use it?
playbook_the_speaker_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with conviction or sacrifice.
playbook_item_symbol_of_your_faith_descr: A symbol used as connection to your faith and as an external sign to impress the folks. Was it given to you? How does it look like?
playbook_item_instrument_of_your_faith_d: An instrument to bring your faith into this world. Who gave it to you or did you create it by yourself? How does it look like?
playbook_item_blessed_implements_for_a_r: Potent implements useable in rituals and scared acts, like healing herbs, magnificent Cologne, holy water, a page from a book, words, carved bones, special Hellstone, specific blood.
playbook_item_a_confession_of_old_descri: Some sins are too dreadful even for the wicked.  Knowledge or a confession about an inglorious past or other despicable acts. How does it look like? Will others believe it?
playbook_item_fine_garments_of_ceremony_: The right clothing for small and even greater ceremonies. Gives an aura of spirital authority and clearly stands out in a crowd.
playbook_item_concealed_palm_pistol_or_b: A small firearm with a weak charge and limited range. A small but sharp blade for very close combat. Both easily concealed in a sleeve or boot.
playbook_the_plan_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with calculation or negotiation.
playbook_the_plan_friend_0: John P. Little, a Cattle Baron
playbook_item_a_concealed_hold_out_pisto: A Derringer or Pepperbox with a weak charge and limited range. Easily concealed in a sleeve, a boot, flowing hair or dress.
playbook_item_fine_status_symbol_descrip: A decent or obvious symbol of high status. A golden watch, snake leather boots, a specific weapon, a suit, a hat, a feather, a book, a bottle of liquor, a pipe etc.
playbook_item_blackmail_information_desc: A dirty or dark secret of one of the prestigious citizens of Mudwater or other location. How did you get it? Who may be hurt when you use it?
playbook_item_fine_ornamented_carriage_d: A finely crafted, prestigious and easy recognizable carriage including horses.
playbook_item_spirit_charm_description: A small symbol or trinket that spirits, ghosts and maybe undead find attractive. How does it look like? What is it origin?
playbook_the_gentle_touch_description: An empathic Light in a dark World
playbook_the_gentle_touch_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with influence or empathy.
playbook_item_fine_concealed_palm_pistol: High quality Derringer or Pepperbox with a weak charge and limited range. Easily concealed in a sleeve, a boot, flowing hair or dress.
playbook_item_fine_bedside_manners_descr: May grant potency in social, non-hostile interactions. What does it look like? Do you use a specific method?
playbook_item_fine_doctors_bag_and_apron: Well crafted instruments to tend your fellow human beings. You're not only a doctor but you look the part, too. May increase the effect of your healing or authority.
playbook_item_fine_and_very_strong_cough: Fine and very strong cough syrup
Something to dull the pain and other sorrows. Alcohol, laudanum, opium, heroin.
playbook_item_a_comforting_song_descript: A well-known song, sang from the heart. May have influence even on hard-boiled outlaws, animals or monsters.
playbook_item_an_old_favor_description: A debt to claim. How did you get it? Who may be hurt when you use it?
playbook_the_wrench_and_saw_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with skill or ingenuity.
playbook_item_fine_crafting_tools_descri: Like normal crafting tools but you can expect better results when wielded by a person who knows her trade.
playbook_item_fine_experimental_rifle_de: A finely crafted two-handed rifle with an experimental (possibly Hellstone-powered) feature. Custom-built for a specific purpose.
playbook_item_fine_useful_parts_descript: Useful (crafting) parts of high quality. May increase the effect of crafting actions.
playbook_item_hellstone_googles_descript: Hellstone-powerde googles with special features. How to they look like? Who may take note?
playbook_item_an_unopened_box_descriptio: Some strange box with unknown content. Is it a dark secret? Who would pay good money to get it?
playbook_item_a_disturbing_truth_descrip: A truth too dark to be in the open. How did you get it? Who may be hurt when you use it? Who is willing to kill so that it stay hidden?
playbook_ability_is_that_all_you_got_des: You may expend your special armor to avoid harm from an attack in combat, or to push yourself during a fight.
playbook_ability_everybodys_kung_fu_figh: You can push yourself to do one of the following: perform a feat of body control or physical force that verges on the superhuman—engage a small gang on equal footing in close combat.
playbook_ability_where_does_that_come_fr: You always have a 1 Load item left regardless of already used load. If you can use the surprise to your advantage gain the initiative even vs. experts.
playbook_ability_st_anger_description: When you open your body and soul to the Burning Beyond you may imbue your hands, melee weapons, or tools with spirit energy. You gain potency in combat vs. the supernatural. You may grapple with spirits to restrain and capture them.
playbook_ability_health_is_better_than_w: You recover from harm faster. Permanently fill in one of your healing clock segments. Take +1d to healing treatment rolls.
playbook_ability_man_of_honor_descriptio: You gain an additional xp trigger: You fought for your or someone else's honor at cost to yourself.  If your posse has problems due to this, also mark posse xp.
playbook_ability_bad_ass_kata_descriptio: Describe how you show off and impress with your physical abilities. If you can exploit this performance for your next move, take improved position or +1 effect (your choice).
playbook_ability_veteran_description: Choose a special ability from another source.
playbook_ability_smoke_and_mirrors_descr: You may expend your special armor to resist harm from combat or appearing to die (fall off a vehicle, disappear in an explosion, etc.) only to reappear in a location of your choosing with a +1d to your next action.
playbook_ability_fancy_dead_eye_descript: You can push yourself to do one of the following: make a ranged attack at extreme distance - perform an impossible shot (ricochet around the corner, trick shots, shot into/through a group of people) - have one last bullet no one counted for
playbook_ability_eastwood_description: Before weapons are drawn you may lock eyes with someone forcing them to hesitate or flinch. Both of you know that you can interrupt whatever they do next. Take +1d for your next action against them.
playbook_ability_lightning_nerves_of_ste: You may always shoot first and you may wait 'til the latest possible moment and still be the first to (re-)act
playbook_ability_silver_bullets_descript: You may enrich your shots with spirit energy. Your shots gain potency in combat vs. the supernatural.
playbook_ability_fill_the_air_with_lead_: Expend your Special Ammunition to do one of the following: unleash a barrage of rapid fire to suppress the enemy -  attack a group/+1 scale.
playbook_ability_stunning_performance_de: You can perform a flashy show with your weapons or horse that leaves your audience stunned and speechless. Take +1 effect to act on this impressed folks or on escape.
playbook_ability_i_am_the_law_descriptio: You may expend your special armor to show your badge of authority to enforce obedience, or to push yourself during a fight.
playbook_ability_a_story_to_tell_descrip: Once per run you can push yourself to tell a story about a dire mess you survived to achieve one of the following: motivate a cohort/mob into fighting or fleeing - give a fighting cohort +1 effect – restore 1 Grit for everybody in the posse.
playbook_ability_this_aint_no_coon_hunt_: When you Command a cohort in combat, they continue to fight when they would otherwise break (they're not taken out when they suffer level 3 harm). They gain +1 effect and 1 armor.
playbook_ability_ask_what_your_country_c: Ask What Your Country Can Do For You
You have access to law enforcement resources. Get +1d when you acquire assets during downtime. All assets have a minimum quality of 1.
playbook_ability_s_only_a_flesh_wound_de: Penalties from harm are one level less severe (though level 4 harm is still fatal). When you accept harm instead of resisting clear 1 Grit.
playbook_ability_moral_compass_descripti: You gain an additional xp trigger: You did the right thing at cost to yourself.  If your posse has problems due to this, also mark posse xp.
playbook_ability_tactical_genius_descrip: You always know the best position during a fight or hunt. If you're able to occupy this position gain +1 Effect for you and everybody who’s there with you.
playbook_ability_all_eyes_on_me_descript: You may expend your special armor to resist an allied characters consequence from detection or to push yourself to impress others. You can always make a grand entrance.
playbook_ability_gamblers_gift_descripti: When someone fools you or takes you by surprise, gain a free 1 Grit Flashback. When you gather information while partying or gambling, gain +1 Effect.
playbook_ability_cutting_cards_descripti: Your skill with cards is mesmerizing. While you perform a card trick, you may alter a memory, implant suggestion or sow a doubt. You may use your playing cards as dangerous throwing weapons.
playbook_ability_heart_of_the_cards_desc: When you accept Position and Effect given by the GM for a roll as is, don't spend any Grit or push the situation (you can still accept a Devils Bargain), and just let the dice decide, regain one Grit.
playbook_ability_fight_with_panache_desc: When you fight in a duel, bystanders won’t interfere. If you use Sling while being in a fight (close Combat?), gain +1 Effect.
playbook_ability_saloon_swagger_descript: Gain +1d in situations where your appearance would be an advantage. If you try to sway someone with a profitable proposition or challenge others to a duel, gain potency.
playbook_ability_miss_fortune_descriptio: Some call you lucky but truth to be told, bad shit just happens to folk who try to mess with you. You may win every game of chance. Spend one GRIT to cause a minor accident (a jammed gun), two for a major one (an exploding stick of dynamite) or three for a catastrophe (a collapsing mineshaft). During Payoff, gain +doom equal to the highest amount of GRIT spend this way.
playbook_ability_darken_than_the_shadows: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence from detection, or to push yourself for a feat of hunting or stealth.
playbook_ability_silent_hunter_descripti: When you gather info to locate a target, you get +1 effect. When you hide in a prepared position or use camouflage, you get +1d to rolls to avoid detection.
playbook_ability_survivor_description: From hard won experience or specialized training, you are able to subsist on what any environment provides and you can function on the barest sustenance. You get +1 grit box.
playbook_ability_learned_my_trade_from_t: Learned my Trade from the Best
When you attack from hiding or spring a trap, you get +1d.
playbook_ability_youre_my_game_descripti: You can smell their blood. When you hunt a target you’ve previously tracked or wounded, you gain +1 effect level. Whenever you gather information on a weakness or vulnerability, the worst you always get is good details.
playbook_ability_like_a_brother_descript: Explain how your mount is helpful in what you’re trying to achieve and gain +1 effect level or +1d. Your mount always knows the way home.
playbook_ability_see_another_day_descrip: You gain an additional xp trigger: You let your prey escape because it was worthy to see another day. If your posse has problems due to this, also mark posse xp.
playbook_ability_listen_to_the_land_desc: Outside of civilization you always know where you are and how to care for yourself and your mount. You may feel a weather change early.
playbook_ability_one_of_those_days_again: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence from a desperate roll, or to escape from what-/wherever you want.
playbook_ability_now_now_now_description: When you push yourself, you may spend +1 Grit (so 3 Grit total) to gain both +1 effect and +1d instead of one or the other.
playbook_ability_dont_saw_that_coming_de: When you make a surprising move beyond civilized or other convention, you get +1d or +1 effect (your choice).
playbook_ability_daredevil_description: When you roll a desperate action, you get +1d to your roll if you also take -1d to any resistance rolls against consequences from your action.
playbook_ability_vengeful_description: You gain an additional xp trigger: You got payback against someone who harmed you or someone you care about. If your posse helped you get payback, also mark posse xp.
playbook_ability_some_fine_reputation_de: Entering a location you may tell us what the people have heard about you. When you reveal your name and exploit your reputation you gain improved position or +1 effect (whatever makes sense)
playbook_ability_blaze_of_glory_descript: When you mark a trauma and say remarkable last words you may retaliate against any and all enemies within range. Say how you bring ruin to your foes before they take you down. You may mark a trauma prematurely to use this ability.
playbook_ability_guided_by_the_totem_des: You may expend your special armor to resist a supernatural consequence, or to push yourself for a feat of athletics or hunt.
playbook_ability_totems_vessel_descripti: When you push yourself and open body and soul as a conduit for your totem, choose one of the following additional benefits: perform a feat of athletics or stealth that verges on the superhuman—maneuver to confuse your enemies so they mistakenly attack each other—sense your prey (gather Info with at least good details) wherever it is.
playbook_ability_protector_of_the_people: When you protect a teammate or your people, take +1d to your resistance roll. When you gather info to anticipate possible threats in the current situation, you get +1 effect.
playbook_ability_a_devil_with_a_blade_de: You’re very effective at finding vital organs with your blade. When using Sling to throw or fight with a blade you gain potency and may choose to do it absolutely silently. On a miss you don’t get any positive result.
playbook_ability_gruesome_warpaint_descr: Enemies falter, hesitate or flinch when attacked by you in close combat. You have an air of menace and danger obvious to even the most unobservant. You gain potency when trying to intimidate someone. If done immediately after a show of force, also take +1d.
playbook_ability_totem_sense_description: Pick an animal sense matching to your totem. This sense is sharpened to animal sensitivity.
playbook_ability_lone_wolf_description: You gain an additional xp trigger: You made things harder by acting alone. If your posse has problems due to this, also mark posse xp.
playbook_ability_walk_through_the_valley: You may expend your special armor to resist a supernatural consequence, or to push yourself when dealing with Hell's forces.
playbook_ability_shepherd_description: You can push yourself to do one of the following: perform a feat of social grace, swaying a crowd or capturing the attention of the Divine.
playbook_ability_a_dogs_nose_description: You always sense the uncouth. Take +1d when you gather info to uncover corruption or find the corrupted.
playbook_ability_hallow_description: You can push yourself to imbue an object or a place with divine power. Gain potency when it comes up against the supernatural.
playbook_ability_curandero_description: When you receive an earnest oath from someone to follow one of your Faith's precepts, they may clear any level of severity of harm, immediately or safely over a short while, you decide. Should they ever break the precept, they take level 2 harm, 'Bedamned'.
playbook_ability_eli_description: One of your senses is so attuned to the world around you, that it can stand in for any one of your others. Get +1d to any action you can mount as a surprise of this unexpected ability or where others are found lacking.
playbook_ability_premonition_description: Have one flashback per session to a vision, dream, prayer or meditation that now comes together and has prepared you for this very moment. The first Grit spent this way is free.
playbook_ability_god_save_me_from_friend: You may expend your special armor to protect a teammate, or to push yourself when you gather information or work on a long-term project.
playbook_ability_foresight_description: Two times per run you can assist a teammate without paying Grit. When you run out of Grit, instead of Trauma you may choose to come back with 1 Grit. Either way tell us how you prepared for this.
playbook_ability_planning_is_everything_: Due to your careful planning, during downtime, you may give yourself or another posse member +1 downtime action.
playbook_ability_runs_in_the_family_desc: During downtime, you get +1 result level when you acquire an asset or reduce doom. You may choose an 'distant cousin' as an asset arriving by train.
playbook_ability_weaving_the_web_descrip: 'By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.' You gain +1d to Consort when you gather information on a target for a run. You get +1d to the engagement roll for that operation. When the engagement roll is 6, gain 1 Grit.
playbook_ability_old_friends_everywhere_: When you come to a new town or settlement, name a Friend, Connection, Vice Purveyor or Enemy you have here. Tell us a story about how you met and about your relationship.
playbook_ability_fingers_in_every_pie_de: At the end of each downtime phase, you earn +2 Indulgence
playbook_ability_snakeoil_miracles_descr: When you assist or engage in a group action with someone, they may also ignore one harm penalty.
playbook_ability_influential_description: You provide a valuable service to the town and are welcome even in dangerous places. Get +1 result level when you speak on behalf of a local community, acquire an asset or reduce doom.
playbook_ability_little_vultures_descrip: Cohorts you command gain potency to gather information and have special armor to resist a consequence of detection or deception.
playbook_ability_well_travelled_descript: You speak a multitude of languages and are broadly educated. When you gather Information in a weird or foreign place, take +1d to your roll.
playbook_ability_fandango_description: When you indulge your vice, you may adjust the dice outcome by 1 or 2 (up or down). An ally who joins your vice may do the same.
playbook_ability_quick_witted_descriptio: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence of persuasion or suspicion. When you resist with guts, take +1d.
playbook_ability_viper_description: When you invent, craft or try to apply a poison or narcotics, take +1d to your roll. You begin the game with one additional formula already known.
playbook_ability_in_good_hands_descripti: When you provide meaningful insight or heartfelt advice, you both clear 1 Grit. Everyone in your posse gets +1d to their healing treatment rolls.
playbook_ability_driven_description: During downtime, you get two ticks to distribute among any long term project clocks that involve investigation or learning a new formula or design plan. While reading, push yourself for 1 Grit instead of 2.
playbook_ability_skillful_description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence from breaking machines or Hellstone, or to push yourself when working on weird science or handling Hellstone.
playbook_ability_mad_scientist_descripti: When you invent or craft a creation with steampunk or Hellstone features, take +1 result level to your roll. You begin with one special design already known.
playbook_ability_spiritmancer_descriptio: When you invent or craft a creation with arcane, spiritual or demonic features, take +1 result level to your roll. You begin with one special formula already known.
playbook_ability_listening_to_their_voic: When you touch them you may consort with machines to Gather Information with +1 result level. After that, you may push yourself to give it a feature or task it was not constructed for.
playbook_ability_speaking_their_tongue_d: You may attune yourself to any machine to active or disable it.
playbook_ability_blood_sweat_and_gears_d: If you achieved a breakthrough on a meaningful invention or scientific problem, mark xp. If your project caused trouble for your posse, also mark posse xp.
playbook_ability_right_time_right_tool_d: You may use one of your items for a purpose of which it was not designed for. Fine items stay fine. Describe how you do it and how this is helpful.
a_pistol_description: A Smith & Wesson revolver, a Colt Dragoon or Buntline, a Navy or Army Colt. A double-action Peacemaker or Thunderer. An antique blackpouder breachloading heavy pistol.
a_melee_weapon_description: A Bowie knife or Arkansas Toothpick. A butcher or skinning knife. A stiletto, rapier or sable. Some sharpened piece of metal or equipment. A hatchet, a tomahawk, a club, brass knuckles.
lantern_description: An oil lantern, a Hellstone lantern or some other light source.
throwing_knifes_description: A set of light and well balanced knifes or a single Arkansas Toothpick.
armor_description: Thick leather vest or waistcoat. A metal plate just at the right spot. An armored vest with Hellstone hardening.
a_large_weapon_description: A two-handed weapon. A spear, a hunting or buffelo rifle, a smoothbore musket, a crossbow, a bow, a polearm, a battle axt.
an_unusual_weapon_description: A curiosity or tool turned into a weapon. A weapon with high need of expertise. A whip, a lasso, bolas, a sling, a viper.
a_horse_with_saddle_description: Your realiable ally and mean of transportation out there in the wild.
climbing_gear_description: A large coil of rope. A small coil of rope. Grappling hooks. A small pouch of chalk dust. A set of iron pitons and a small mallet.
documents_description: A collection of possibly useful documents. Some interesting maps. Some blank pages. A pen or pencil. How taught you to read and write?
arcane_implements_description: A vial of quicksilver, blood or perfume. Peyote. A pouch of black salt, bone dust or grated Hellstone. A small stone or bone with a carved rune. A holy symbol. Hair or fingernails of a dead man.  A sand timer. Dried frog skin.
subterfuge_supplies_description: A theatrical makeup kit. Faked gold nugget or Hellstone. A forged badge of authority or symbol of faith. A selection of blank documents, ready for the forger’s hand.
demolition_tools_description: A stick of dynamite, a nail bomb, a heavy hammer, a crowbar, a drill. A vial of nitroglycerin (explain, how you managed to avoid the explosion 'til now).
crafting_tools_description: An assortment for blacksmiths, carpenters, Hellstone mechanist work: A loupe, tweezers, a big/small hammer, pliers, screwdriver, file, saw, hatchet, Hellstone fork, battery.
a_spirit_bane_description: A small pendant, trinket, rock or bone that spirits, ghosts and maybe undead prefer to avoid. How does it look like? What is its origin?
an_useful_item_description: Some useful item you may need just now. Explain way it is useful and why you brought it along. Snake Leather Boots? Guitar / Banjo / Harmonica? Magnificent Cologne? A piece of Hellstone? A Hellstone detector? A pipe?
attune_description: Attune to spirits, demons, undead and the Burning Beyond; channel supernatural energy; perceive and communicate with ghosts; understand spectrology.

disable_description: Disable a trap, pick a lock, or crack a safe subtlety or with force; break an item, or obstacle with force or carefully applied sabotage; breach defenses with force; create distractions and chaos.
fill_fields: Fill in sheet fields automatically upon entering or changing playbook or posse type
sling_description: Sling a pistol in a shoot-out, throw a blade, a lasso or item. Pick an item from someone's pocket; employ subtle misdirection or sleight-of-hand; handle a vehicle or a mount.
flexible_width: Flexible character sheet width (adapts to container)
craft_description: Craft mechanisms (create, modify, disable, or repair); reinforce or enhance constructions; understand and use steam- or Hellstone-devices to your advantage.

prowl_description: Prowl about unseen and traverse obstacles; climb, swim, run, jump, and tumble. Ambush with close violence—a backstab, throat cutting, etc.
query_for_consequence: Query for consequence name when resisting
read_description: Read a person, text, document, or item with close scrutiny to gather information and apply knowledge or first aid or healing; recite text or gain a deeper understanding; do research.
recoveryblurb: Get treatment in downtime to activate your healing project clock
resist_instructions: Lose 6 grit minus the highest die result. When you roll a critical on resistance, gain 1 grit.
show_broadcast: Show broadcast buttons for sending information to chat
show_cohort_section: Show cohort section on character sheet
show_outline: Show outline for active input fields
survey_description: Survey a location or situation to understand what's going on; sense trouble before it happens; gather information about opportunities or exploits.
sway_description: Sway someone with charm, logic, deception, disguise, or bluff; perform on stage. Change attitudes or behavior with manipulation or seduction.
upgrade_insight_description: Earn 2 xp when training insight during downtime.
upgrade_mastery_description: Your posse has access to master level training. You may advance your PCs' action ratings to 4 (until you unlock this upgrade, PC action ratings are capped at 3). This costs four upgrade boxes to unlock.
upgrade_personal_description: Earn 2 xp when training playbook during downtime.
upgrade_prowess_description: Earn 2 xp when training prowess during downtime.
upgrade_guts_description: Earn 2 xp when training guts during downtime.
upon_crew_advance: Upon posse advance, each PC gets Indulgence = Tier+2
use_kirsty: Use Kirsty font if installed (only check if you have Kirsty)
vice_info: Faith — Gambling — Luxury — Obligation — Pleasure — Stupor — Weird
vice_instructions: Gain an amount of grit equal to the highest die result. If the result of your vice roll means you gain more than 9 grit, you overindulge.
warblurb1: When you're at war with any number of factions (status -3), the following penalties apply:
warblurb2: Lose 1 hold (temporarily, while the war persists). This may knock you down a Tier.
warblurb3: PCs get only one free downtime action instead of two.
warblurb5: Your Hellstone claims produce only half their normal harvest (round down).

xp_desperate: Every time you roll a desperate action, mark xp in that action's attribute.
xp_express: Express the goals, drives, inner conflict, or essential nature of the posse.

xp_specific_extra: Enter another specific way to mark XP here.
xp_top: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 xp (or instead mark 2 xp if that item occurred multiple times).
xp_vice: You struggled with issues from your vice or traumas during the session.
